003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

005 * "Simplified" License (see http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-2-Clause).

009package imagingbook.common.image;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
016import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
017import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
018import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
020import imagingbook.common.image.access.ImageAccessor;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * This class defines a generic data container for scalar and
025 * vector-valued images, using float-values throughout.
026 * Its primary use is in the {@link GenericFilter} framework.
027 * A {@link PixelPack} may represent images with an arbitrary number of
028 * components. Scalar images (such as {@link ByteProcessor}, 
029 * {@link ShortProcessor} and {@link FloatProcessor}) have 1 component,
030 * color images (such as {@link ColorProcessor}) typically have 3 components.
031 * Conversion methods to and from ImageJ's processor classes are provided,
032 * with optional scaling of pixel component values.
033 * </p>
034 * <p>
035 * Internally, pixel data are stored as 1-dimensional {@code float} arrays,
036 * one array for each component.
037 * Method {@link #getData()} may be used to access the internal data directly.
038 * Individual components may be extracted as a {@link PixelSlice} using
039 * method {@link #getSlice(int)}.
040 * </p>
041 * <p>
042 * Methods {@link #getPix(int, int)} and {@link #setPix(int, int, float...)} are
043 * provided to read and write individual pixels, which are 
044 * ALWAYS of type {@code float[]} (even if the underlying image is scalar-valued).
045 * Pixel values returned for positions outside the image boundaries depend 
046 * on the {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy} specified by the constructor
047 * (e.g., {@link #PixelPack(ImageProcessor, double, OutOfBoundsStrategy)}).
048 * </p>
049 * <p>Here is a simple usage example:</p>
050 * <pre>
051 * ColorProcessor ip1 = ... ;   // some color image
052 * PixelPack pack = new PixelPack(ip1);
053 * // process pack:
054 * float[] val = pack.getPix(0, 0);
055 * pack.setPix(0, 0, 128, 19, 255);
056 * ...
057 * ColorProcessor ip2 = pack.toColorProcessor();
058 * </pre>
059 * <p>
060 * A related concept for providing unified access to images is {@link ImageAccessor}.
061 * In contrast to {@link PixelPack}, {@link ImageAccessor} does not duplicate
062 * any data but reads and writes the original {@link ImageProcessor} pixel data
063 * directly.
064 * </p>
065 * 
066 * @author WB
067 * @version 2022/09/03
068 * @see ImageAccessor
069 */
070public class PixelPack {
071        
072        /** The default out-of-bounds strategy (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
073        public static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;
074
075        protected final int width;
076        protected final int height;
077        protected final int depth;
078        protected final float[][] data;
079        protected final int length;
080        private final GridIndexer2D indexer;
081        
082        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
083        
084        /**
085         * Constructor. Creates a blank (zero-valued) pack of pixel data.
086         * @param width the image width
087         * @param height the image height
088         * @param depth the number of channels (slices)
089         * @param obs strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates (pass {@code null} for default)
090         */
091        public PixelPack(int width, int height, int depth, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
092                this.width = width;
093                this.height = height;
094                this.depth = depth;
095                this.length = width * height;
096                this.data = new float[depth][length];
097                this.indexer = GridIndexer2D.create(width, height, obs);
098        }
099        
100        /**
101         * Constructor. Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
102         * {@link ImageProcessor} object.
103         * Does not scale pixel values and uses
104         * {@link #DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy} as the out-of-bounds strategy
105         * (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}).
106         * @param ip the source image
107         */
108        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip) {
109                this(ip, 1.0, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy);
110        }
111        
112        /**
113         * Constructor. Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
114         * {@link ImageProcessor} object, using the specified out-of-bounds strategy.
115         * @param ip the source image
116         * @param scale scale factor applied to pixel components
117         * @param obs strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates (pass {@code null} for default)
118         */
119        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip, double scale, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
120                this(ip.getWidth(), ip.getHeight(), ip.getNChannels(), obs);
121                copyFromImageProcessor(ip, scale);
122        }
123        
124        /**
125         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link PixelPack} with the same dimension
126         * as the original without copying the contained pixel data
127         * (initialized to zero).
128         * 
129         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
130         */
131        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig) {
132                this(orig, false);
133        }
134        
135        /**
136         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link PixelPack} with the same dimension
137         * as the original.
138         * Optionally the original pixel data are copied, otherwise they are initialized 
139         * to zero values.
140         * 
141         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
142         * @param copyData set true to copy pixel data
143         */
144        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig, boolean copyData) {
145                this(orig.getWidth(), orig.getHeight(), orig.getDepth(), orig.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy());
146                if (copyData) {
147                        orig.copyTo(this);
148                }
149        }
150        
151        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
152        
153        @Deprecated // use getPix(int u, int v, float[] vals)
154        public float[] getVec(int u, int v, float[] vals) {
155                getPix(u, v, vals);
156                return vals;
157        }
158        
159        @Deprecated     // use getPix(int u, int v)
160        public float[] getVec(int u, int v) {
161                return getPix(u, v);
162        }
163        
164        @Deprecated     // use setPix(int u, int v, float ... vals) 
165        public void setVec(int u, int v, float ... vals) {
166                setPix(u, v, vals);
167        }
168        
169        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
170
171        /**
172         * Reads the pixel data at the specified image position.
173         * The supplied array is filled.
174         * The length of this array must match corresponds the number of slices in this
175         * pixel pack.
176         * The values returned for out-of-bounds positions depend on this
177         * pixel-pack's out-of-bounds strategy.
178         * 
179         * @param u the x-position
180         * @param v the y-position
181         * @param vals a suitable array of pixel data
182         */
183        public void getPix(int u, int v, float[] vals) {
184                if (vals == null) 
185                        vals = new float[depth];
186                final int idx = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
187                if (idx < 0) {  // i = -1 --> default value (zero)
188                        Arrays.fill(vals, 0);
189                }
190                else {  
191//                      for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
192//                              vals[k] = data[k][i];
193//                      }
194                        getPix(idx, vals);
195                }
196        }
197        
198        /**
199         * Returns the pixel data at the specified position as a {@code float[]}.
200         * The values returned for out-of-bounds positions depend on this
201         * pixel-pack's out-of-bounds strategy.
202         * 
203         * @param u the x-position
204         * @param v the y-position
205         * @return the array of pixel component values
206         */
207        public float[] getPix(int u, int v) {
208                float[] vals = new float[depth];
209                getPix(u, v, vals);
210                return vals;
211        }
212        
213        /**
214         * Reads the pixel data at the specified 1D index.
215         * The supplied array is filled.
216         * The length of this array must match corresponds the number of slices in this
217         * pixel pack.
218         * The index is not checked, the corresponding pixel must always be inside
219         * the image bounds, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
220         * 
221         * @param idx a valid 1D pixel index (in row-major order)
222         * @param vals a suitable array of pixel data
223         */
224        public void getPix(int idx, float[] vals) {
225                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
226                        vals[k] = data[k][idx];
227                }
228        }
229        
230        /**
231         * Returns the pixel data at the specified position as a {@code float[]}.
232         * The index is not checked, the corresponding pixel must always be inside
233         * the image bounds, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
234         * @param idx a valid 1D pixel index (in row-major order)
235         * @return the array of pixel component values
236         */
237        public float[] getPix(int idx) {
238                float[] vals = new float[depth];
239                getPix(idx, vals);
240                return vals;
241        }
242
243        
244        /**
245         * Sets the pixel data at the specified pixel position.
246         * The length of the value array corresponds to the number of slices 
247         * (components) in this pixel pack.
248         * @param u the x-position
249         * @param v the y-position
250         * @param vals the pixel's component values (may also be a {@code float[]})
251         */
252        public void setPix(int u, int v, float ... vals) {
253                final int idx = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
254                if (idx >= 0) {
255//                      for (int k = 0; k < depth && k < vals.length; k++) {
256//                              data[k][i] = vals[k];
257//                      }
258                        setPix(idx, vals);
259                }
260        }
261        
262        public void setPix(int idx, float ... vals) {
263                for (int k = 0; k < depth && k < vals.length; k++) {
264                        data[k][idx] = vals[k];
265                }
266        }
267        
268        /**
269         * Copies the contents of one pixel pack to another.
270         * The involved pixel packs must have the same dimensions.
271         * @param other another pixel pack
272         */
273        public void copyTo(PixelPack other) {
274                if (!this.isCompatibleTo(other)) {
275                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("pixel packs of incompatible size, cannot copy");
276                }
277                for (int k = 0; k < this.depth; k++) {
278                        System.arraycopy(this.data[k], 0, other.data[k], 0, this.length);
279                }
280        }
281        
282        /**
283         * Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as another
284         * pixel pack, i.e., can be copied to it.
285         * @param other the other pixel pack
286         * @return true if both have the same dimensions
287         */
288        public boolean isCompatibleTo(PixelPack other) {
289                if (this.data.length == other.data.length && this.length == other.length) { // TODO: check width/height too
290                        return true;
291                }
292                else
293                        return false;
294        }
295        
296        /**
297         * Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as the
298         * specified {@link ImageProcessor} instance, i.e., can be copied to it.
299         * @param ip the image processor instance
300         * @return true if compatible
301         */
302        public boolean isCompatibleTo(ImageProcessor ip) {
303                if (this.getWidth() != ip.getWidth() || this.getHeight() != ip.getHeight()) {
304                        return false;
305                }
306                if (this.getDepth() != ip.getNChannels()) {
307                        return false;
308                }
309                return true;
310        }
311        
312        /**
313         * Returns the kth {@link PixelSlice}.
314         * An exception is thrown if the specified slice does not exist.
315         * @param k the slice index (0,...,K-1)
316         * @return the kth {@link PixelSlice}
317         */
318        public PixelSlice getSlice(int k) throws IllegalArgumentException {
319                if (k < 0 || k >= depth) {
320                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illegal slice number " + k);
321                }
322                return new PixelSlice(k);
323        }
324        
325        /**
326         * Creates and returns a new {@link PixelSlice} with the same dimensions
327         * and out-of-bounds strategy as this {@link PixelPack}.
328         * @return a new pixel slice
329         */
330        public PixelSlice getEmptySlice() {
331                return new PixelSlice();
332        }
333        
334        /**
335         * Returns an array of {@link PixelSlice} instances
336         * for this {@link PixelPack}. All pixel data are shared.
337         * 
338         * @return an array of {@link PixelSlice}
339         */
340        public PixelSlice[] getSlices() {
341                PixelSlice[] slices = new PixelSlice[depth];
342                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
343                        slices[k] = getSlice(k);
344                }
345                return slices;
346        }
347        
348        /**
349         * Returns the {@link FloatProcessor} for the kth pixel slice.
350         * An exception is thrown if the specified slice does not exist.
351         * @param k the slice index (0,...,K-1)
352         * @return the kth {@link FloatProcessor}
353         */
354        public FloatProcessor getFloatProcessor(int k) {
355                return getSlice(k).getFloatProcessor();
356        }
357        
358        
359        /**
360         * Returns an array of {@link FloatProcessor} instances
361         * for this {@link PixelPack}. All pixel data are shared.
362         * 
363         * @return an array of {@link FloatProcessor}
364         */
365        public FloatProcessor[] getFloatProcessors() {
366                FloatProcessor[] processors = new FloatProcessor[depth];
367                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
368                        processors[k] = getFloatProcessor(k);
369                }
370                return processors;
371        }
372        
373        /**
374         * Returns a reference to this {@link PixelPack}'s internal data
375         * array, which is always two-dimensional:
376         * dimension 1 is the slice (component) index,
377         * dimension 2 is the pixel index (each slice is a 1D array).
378         * @return the pixel pack's data array
379         */
380        public float[][] getData() {
381                return data;
382        }
383        
384        /**
385         * Returns the width of the associated image.
386         * @return the image width
387         */
388        public int getWidth() {
389//              return this.indexer.getWidth();
390                return this.width;
391        }
392        
393        /**
394         * Returns the height of the associated image.
395         * @return the image height
396         */
397        public int getHeight() {
398//              return this.indexer.getHeight();
399                return this.height;
400        }
401        
402        /**
403         * Returns the depth (number of slices) of the associated image.
404         * @return the image depth
405         */
406        public int getDepth() {
407                return this.depth;
408        }
409        
410        /**
411         * Returns the out-of-bounds strategy.
412         * @return the out-of-bounds strategy
413         */
414        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy() {
415                return this.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy();
416        }
417
418        /**
419         * Sets all values of this pixel pack to zero.
420         */
421        public void zero() {
422                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
423                        getSlice(k).zero();
424                }
425        }
426        
427        /**
428         * Returns the pixel values in the 3x3 neighborhood around the
429         * specified position.
430         * The returned float-array has the structure {@code [x][y][k]},
431         * with x,y = 0,...,2  and k is the slice index.
432         * 
433         * @param uc the center x-position
434         * @param vc the center x-position
435         * @param nh a float array to be filled in (or null)
436         * @return the neighborhood array
437         */
438        public float[][][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][][] nh) {
439                if (nh == null) 
440                        nh = new float[3][3][depth];
441                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
442                        int u = uc - 1 + i;
443                        for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
444                                int v = vc - 1 + j;
445                                nh[i][j] = getPix(u, v);
446                        }
447                }
448                return nh;
449        }
450        
451//      /**
452//       * Copies the contents of this pixel pack to the supplied {@link ImageProcessor}
453//       * instance, if compatible. Otherwise an exception is thrown.
454//       * 
455//       * @param ip the target image processor
456//       */
457//      public void copyToImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) {
458//              copyToImageProcessor(this, ip);
459//      }
460        
461        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
462        
463        /**
464         * Inner class representing a single (scalar-valued) component of a 
465         * (vector-valued) {@link PixelPack}.
466         *
467         */
468        public class PixelSlice {
469                private final int idx;
470                private final float[] vals;
471                
472                /**
473                 * Constructor. Creates a pixel slice for the specified component.
474                 * @param idx the slice (component) index
475                 */
476                PixelSlice(int idx) {
477                        this.idx = idx;
478                        this.vals = data[idx];
479                }
480                
481                /** Constructor. Creates an empty (zero-valued) pixel slice with the same
482                 * properties as the containing pixel pack but not associated
483                 * with it.
484                 */
485                PixelSlice() {
486                        this.idx = -1;
487                        this.vals = new float[length];
488                }
489                
490                /**
491                 * Returns the pixel value for the specified image position.
492                 * @param u the x-position
493                 * @param v the y-position
494                 * @return the slice value
495                 */
496                public float getVal(int u, int v) {
497                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
498                        return (i >= 0) ? vals[i] : 0;
499                }
500                
501                /**
502                 * Sets the pixel value at the specified image position.
503                 * @param u the x-position
504                 * @param v the y-position
505                 * @param val the new value
506                 */
507                public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
508                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
509                        if (i >= 0) {
510                                vals[i] = val;
511                        }
512                }
513                
514                /**
515                 * Returns the slice index for this pixel slice, i.e, the
516                 * component number in the containing pixel pack.
517                 * -1 is returned if the pixel slice is not associated with
518                 * a pixel pack.
519                 * @return the slice index
520                 */
521                public int getIndex() {
522                        return idx;
523                }
524                
525                /** 
526                 * Returns a reference to the data array associated with this pixel slice.
527                 * @return the data array
528                 */
529                public float[] getArray() {
530                        return vals;
531                }
532                
533                /**
534                 * Returns a {@link FloatProcessor} for this {@link PixelSlice} 
535                 * sharing the internal pixel data (nothing is copied).
536                 * 
537                 * @return a {@link FloatProcessor}
538                 */
539                public FloatProcessor getFloatProcessor() {
540                        return new FloatProcessor(getWidth(), getHeight(), vals);
541                }
542                
543                /**
544                 * Returns the length (number of pixels) of the associated 1D pixel array.
545                 * @return the length of the image array
546                 */
547                public int getLength() {
548                        return vals.length;
549                }
550                
551                /**
552                 * Returns the width of the associated image
553                 * (see also {@link GridIndexer2D}).
554                 * @return the image width
555                 */
556                public int getWidth() {
557                        return PixelPack.this.getWidth();
558                }
559                
560                /**
561                 * Returns the height of the associated image
562                 * (see also {@link GridIndexer2D}).
563                 * @return the image height
564                 */
565                public int getHeight() {
566                        return PixelPack.this.getHeight();
567                }
568                
569                /**
570                 * Sets all pixel values to zero.
571                 */
572                public void zero() {
573                        Arrays.fill(this.vals, 0);
574                }
575                
576                /**
577                 * Copies the contents of this pixel slice to another
578                 * pixel slice.
579                 * @param other the pixel slice to modified
580                 */
581                public void copyTo(PixelSlice other) {
582                        System.arraycopy(this.vals, 0, other.vals, 0, this.vals.length);
583                }
584                
585                /**
586                 * Returns the pixel values from the 3x3 neighborhood centered at
587                 * the specified position.
588                 * The 3x3 array {@code nh[x][y]} has the coordinates
589                 * x = 0,..,2 and y = 0,..,2; 
590                 * the value at position {@code [1][1]} belongs to the 
591                 * specified position.
592                 * If a non-null array is supplied, it is filled and returned.
593                 * If null, a new array is created and returned.
594                 * 
595                 * @param uc the center x-position
596                 * @param vc the center y-position
597                 * @param nh a 3x3 array or null
598                 * @return a 3x3 array of pixel values
599                 */
600                public float[][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][] nh) {
601                        if (nh == null) 
602                                nh = new float[3][3];
603                        for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
604                                int u = uc - 1 + i;
605                                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
606                                        int v = vc - 1 + j;
607                                        nh[i][j] = getVal(u, v);
608                                }
609                        }
610                        return nh;
611                }
612        }
613        
614        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
615
616        /**
617         * Copies the contents of an image processor to an existing
618         * pixel pack, which must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
619         * Does not scale pixel values.
620         * 
621         * @param ip the image processor to be copied
622         */
623        public void copyFromImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) {
624                copyFromImageProcessor(ip, 1.0);
625        }
626        
627        /**
628         * Copies the contents of an image processor to an existing
629         * pixel pack, which must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
630         * Applies the specified scale factor to the pixel component values.
631         * 
632         * @param ip the image processor to be copied
633         * @param scale scale factor applied to pixel component values
634         */
635        public void copyFromImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip, double scale) {
636                if (!isCompatibleTo(ip) ){
637                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("copyFromImageProcessor(): incompatible ImageProcessor/PixelPack)");
638                }
639                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
640                        copyFromByteProcessor((ByteProcessor)ip, (float) scale);
641                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
642                        copyFromShortProcessor((ShortProcessor)ip, (float) scale);
643                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
644                        copyFromFloatProcessor((FloatProcessor)ip, (float) scale);
645                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
646                        copyFromColorProcessor((ColorProcessor)ip, (float) scale);
647                else 
648                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
649        }
650        
651        private void copyFromByteProcessor(ByteProcessor ip, final float scale) {
652                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
653                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
654                        data[0][i] = scale * (0xff & pixels[i]);
655                }
656        }
657        
658        private void copyFromShortProcessor(ShortProcessor ip, final float scale) {
659                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
660                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
661                        data[0][i] = scale * (0xffff & pixels[i]);
662                }
663        }
664        
665        private void copyFromFloatProcessor(FloatProcessor ip, final float scale) {
666                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
667//              System.arraycopy(pixels, 0, data[0], 0, pixels.length);
668                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
669                        data[0][i] = scale * pixels[i];
670                }
671        }
672        
673        private void copyFromColorProcessor(ColorProcessor ip, final float scale) {
674                final int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
675                final int[] rgb = new int[3];
676                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
677                        RgbUtils.decodeIntToRgb(pixels[i], rgb);
678                        data[0][i] = scale * rgb[0];
679                        data[1][i] = scale * rgb[1];
680                        data[2][i] = scale * rgb[2];
681                }
682        }
683        
684        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
685        
686        /**
687         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ByteProcessor} instance.
688         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
689         * Pixel values are rounded, no scale factor is applied.
690         * 
691         * @return a new {@link ByteProcessor} instance
692         */
693        public ByteProcessor toByteProcessor() {
694                return toByteProcessor(1.0);
695        }
696        
697        /**
698         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ByteProcessor} instance.
699         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
700         * Applies the specified scale factor to pixel values.
701         * 
702         * @param scale scale factor applied to pixel values (before rounding)
703         * @return a new {@link ByteProcessor} instance
704         */
705        public ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(double scale) {
706                if (depth != 1) {
707                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("cannot convert to ByteProcessor, depth = " + depth);
708                }
709                ByteProcessor ip = new ByteProcessor(width, height);
710                copyToByteProcessor(ip, (float)scale);
711                return ip;
712        }
713        
714        /**
715         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ShortProcessor} instance.
716         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
717         * Pixel values are rounded, no scale factor is applied.
718         * 
719         * @return a new {@link ShortProcessor} instance
720         */
721        public ShortProcessor toShortProcessor() {
722                return toShortProcessor(1.0);
723        }
724        
725        /**
726         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ShortProcessor} instance.
727         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
728         * Applies the specified scale factor to pixel values.
729         * 
730         * @param scale scale factor applied to pixel values (before rounding)
731         * @return a new {@link ShortProcessor} instance
732         */
733        public ShortProcessor toShortProcessor(double scale) {
734                if (depth != 1) {
735                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("cannot convert to ShortProcessor, depth = " + depth);
736                }
737                ShortProcessor ip = new ShortProcessor(width, height);
738                copyToShortProcessor(ip, (float)scale);
739                return ip;
740        }
741        
742        /**
743         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance.
744         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
745         * No scale factor is applied to pixel values.
746         * 
747         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
748         */
749        public FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor() {
750                return toFloatProcessor(1.0);
751        }
752        
753        /**
754         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance.
755         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 1.
756         * 
757         * @param scale scale factor applied to pixel values
758         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
759         */
760        public FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double scale) {
761                if (depth != 1) {
762                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("cannot convert to FloatProcessor, depth = " + depth);
763                }
764                FloatProcessor ip = new FloatProcessor(width, height);
765                copyToFloatProcessor(ip, (float)scale);
766                return ip;
767        }
768        
769        /**
770         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ColorProcessor} instance.
771         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 3.
772         * Component values are rounded, no scale factor is applied.
773         * 
774         * @return a new {@link ColorProcessor} instance
775         */
776        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor() {
777                return toColorProcessor(1.0);
778        }
779        
780        /**
781         * Converts this {@link PixelPack} to a new {@link ColorProcessor} instance.
782         * An exception is thrown if the depth of the pack is not equal 3.
783         * 
784         * @param scale scale factor applied to component values (before rounding)
785         * @return a new {@link ColorProcessor} instance
786         */
787        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor(double scale) {
788                if (depth != 3) {
789                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("cannot convert to ColorProcessor, depth = " + depth);
790                }
791                ColorProcessor ip = new ColorProcessor(width, height);
792                copyToColorProcessor(ip, (float)scale);
793                return ip;
794        }
795        
796        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
797        
798        /**
799         * Copies the contents of a pixel pack to an existing
800         * image processor. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
801         * Component values are rounded if necessary, no scale factor is applied.
802         * 
803         * @param ip the receiving image processor
804         */
805        public void copyToImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) {
806                copyToImageProcessor(ip, 1.0);
807        }
808        
809        /**
810         * Copies the contents of a pixel pack to an existing
811         * image processor. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
812         * Component values are rounded if necessary, after the
813         * specified scale factor is applied.
814         * 
815         * @param ip the receiving image processor
816         * @param scale  scale factor applied to pixel values
817         */
818        public void copyToImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip, double scale) {
819                if (!this.isCompatibleTo(ip) ){
820                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("copyToImageProcessor(): incompatible ImageProcessor/PixelPack)");
821                }
822                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
823                        copyToByteProcessor((ByteProcessor)ip, (float)scale);
824                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
825                        copyToShortProcessor((ShortProcessor)ip, (float)scale);
826                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
827                        copyToFloatProcessor((FloatProcessor)ip, (float)scale);
828                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
829                        copyToColorProcessor((ColorProcessor)ip, (float)scale);
830                else
831                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
832        }
833        
834        private void copyToByteProcessor(ByteProcessor ip, float scale) {
835                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
836                float[] P = this.data[0];
837                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
838                        int val = clipByte(Math.round(scale * P[i]));
839                        pixels[i] = (byte) val;
840                }
841        }
842        
843        private void copyToShortProcessor(ShortProcessor ip, float scale) {
844                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
845                float[] P = this.data[0];
846                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
847                        int val = clipShort(Math.round(scale * P[i]));
848                        pixels[i] = (short) val;
849                }
850        }
851        
852        private void copyToFloatProcessor(FloatProcessor ip, float scale) {
853                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
854                float[] P = this.data[0];
855//              System.arraycopy(P, 0, pixels, 0, P.length);
856                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
857                        pixels[i] = scale * P[i];
858                }
859        }
860        
861        private void copyToColorProcessor(ColorProcessor ip, float scale) {
862                int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
863                float[] R = this.data[0];
864                float[] G = this.data[1];
865                float[] B = this.data[2];
866                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
867                        int r = clipByte(Math.round(scale * R[i]));
868                        int g = clipByte(Math.round(scale * G[i]));
869                        int b = clipByte(Math.round(scale * B[i]));
870                        pixels[i] = RgbUtils.encodeRgbToInt(r, g, b);
871                }
872        }
873        
874        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
875        
876        private int clipByte(int val) {
877                if (val < 0) return 0;
878                if (val > 255) return 255;
879                return val;
880        }
881        
882        private int clipShort(int val) {
883                if (val < 0) return 0;
884                if (val > 65535) return 65535;
885                return val;
886        }
887
888}
